divs: sighting details2\20\08: last night at about 9:05 i went out to look at the lunar eclipse and noticed 2 orange bright lights. i live in northwest chicago and it looked like the lights came in from the east, but traveled from north to south over the downtown chicago. it was a very clear night. i would describe what i saw as 2 bright orange objects travling at a slow speed. i estimate they were about 8-10 miles away from me.i had a pair of binoculars with me.i didn't see any kind of craft outline but just the lights. there wasn't any after glow.they were roundish, about the size of a softball from where i was at and travling side by side.they stayed at one speed. they traveled exaclty even with each other until the very end of my sighting before disappering into the horizan.my guess was they must have been about 3000-5000 feet above ground. not high in the sky. i would say they took about 10 minutes or so to travel across the city. they weren't flying like an aircraft but more like they were floating very smoothly. near the end of the sighting one of the crafts seem to go out of line to the east and came back to fly with the other craft. then they were out of sight heading to the south.
